greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: If n is of the form s^(2^e), where s is a squarefree number, and e >= 0, then a(n) = 1+e, otherwise a(n) = 0.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..65537
Index entries for sequences computed from exponents in factorization of n
mathematica: a[1] = 0; a[n_] := If[Length[(u = Union[FactorInteger[n][[;; , 2]]])] == 1 && u[[1]] == 2^(e = IntegerExponent[u[[1]], 2]), e + 1, 0]; Array[a, 100] (* _Amiram Eldar_, Feb 10 2021 *)
xref: Positions of nonzero terms: A340682, of terms > 1: A340674.
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Feb 01 2021
